DOC.brief_summary: The study objective evaluate safety performance ConforMIS iUni® Unicompartmental Knee Resurfacing Device patient single compartment osteoarthritis . The iUni patient-specific unicompartmental resurfacing device design patient 's unique anatomy use proprietary software interprets data patient 's CT scan . The patient match implant design couple unique patient-matched disposable instrumentation design use CT data software .
DOC.brief_title: Multi-Center Study Evaluate ConforMIS iUni Knee Implant
DOC.criteria: 1 . Clinical condition include approved Indications For Use 2 . Unicompartmental osteoarthritis medial lateral tibiofemoral compartment 3 . Willingness participate clinical study , give informed consent attend followup visit 4 . > 18 year age 1 . Simultaneous bilateral procedure require 2 . BMI > 35 3 . Treatment cancer within past 5 year , exception skin cancer 4 . Poorly control diabetes 5 . Neuromuscular condition prevent patient participate study activity 6 . Active local systemic infection 7 . Immunocompromised 8 . Fibromyalgia general body pain related condition 9 . Advanced tricompartmental osteoarthritis 10 . Symptomatic patellofemoral disease 11 . Rheumatoid arthritis form inflammatory joint disease 12 . Loss bone musculature , osteoporosis , osteonecrosis , neuromuscular vascular compromise area joint operate extent procedure unjustified 13 . Advanced loss osteochondral structure affect femoral condyle 14 . Compromised ACL , PCL collateral ligament 15 . Severe ( > 15º ) fix valgus varus deformity 16 . Extension deficit > 15 º 17 . Prior history fail implant surgery joint treat 18 . Unwilling unable comply study requirement 19 . Participation another clinical study would confound result
